duties_responsibilities.duty: Supervise teams of Operators and Technicians performing Outside Plant (OSP) construction
Prepare logistics plans for work within assigned regions and mobilize to work locations daily
Drive the safety culture, ensure safety standards and best practices are applied at all times
Coordinate deliveries, purchase materials, and work with inter-departmental team members to drive favorable financial outcomes
Aid in the execution of innovative technologies and ensure site and equipment safety checks are conducted
Read and interpret engineering designs and construction drawings, providing support to monitor and report Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
Maintain knowledge of technology impact on operational business process and support CAPEX and OPEX spend and budgets
Create and maintain a schedule for a team of technicians, including travel logistics and planning
Supervise the necessary network installation and maintenance activities 24/7, overseeing site construction, schedule management, resources, and safety practices on all projects
Ensure compliance with permitting, Method of Transportation (MOT), and underground facility locating requirements
Ensure all work is completed in accordance with construction standards, processes, and procedures

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or equivalent required with a valid driver's license - DOT/ CDL preferred, OSHA 10 required, OSHA 30 or greater preferred
